Justification: Jonathan Harker begins as a rational man of logic and law.
He slowly realizes he’s trapped, experiencing fear and helplessness.
Van Helsing introduces a spiritual war, shifting the tone and strategy.
Lucy’s death and Mina’s targeting deepen the group's desperation.
They accept their roles as monster-hunters—sacrificing normal life.
The group defeats Dracula, changed by trauma, grief, and shared resolve.
